chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:

Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney J. Foss Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maloria Cecelia Allen in court, in custody. 
Defendant wishes to obtain counsel first, SPD still looking for counsel. 
Defendant may be transported to Taycheedah before next date. 
Present bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with D.D.G., unless authorized through CPS, or their residence or place of employment.
Defendant to have no contact with Damien Gambrell or their residence or place of employment.

Defendant Maloria Cecelia Allen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney P. Heyne appears on behalf of the Defendant.
Attorney K. Stueck appears, in-person, on behalf of the State.
Defense argues Count 2, "Neglecting a Child - Specified Harm did not occur and child has a Disability" should be dismissed  as they do not believe the defendant was responsible for the care/custody of the child.
Court hears argument
Count w is dismissed by Court
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
